left thoracoscopy and left thoracotomy.context: Left thoracoscopy and left thoracotomy with declaudication and drainage of lung abscesses, and multiple biopsies of pleura and lung.

empyema of the left chest.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: Empyema of the left chest and consolidation of the left lung.

consolidation of the left lung.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: Empyema of the left chest and consolidation of the left lung.

lung abscesses of the left upper lobe an.context: Postoperative Diagnoses: Empyema of the left chest, consolidation of the left lung, lung abscesses of the left upper lobe and left lower lobe.

30-year history of cigarette smoking.context: The patient had a 30-year history of cigarette smoking.

hemoptysis.context: one week ago she was admitted to another hospital with hemoptysis and on her evaluation there which included two CAT scans of chest she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung with a questionable lung abscess or cavity with hydropneumothorax.

respiratory symptoms.context: The patient has a complex history, which goes back about four months ago when she started having respiratory symptoms and one week ago she was admitted to another hospital with hemoptysis and on her evaluation there which included two CAT scans of chest she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung with a questionable lung abscess or cavity with hydropneumothorax.

CAT scans of chest.context: one week ago she was admitted to another hospital with hemoptysis and on her evaluation there which included two CAT scans of chest she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung with a questionable lung abscess or cavity with hydropneumothorax.

questionable lung abscess or cavity with.context: one week ago she was admitted to another hospital with hemoptysis and on her evaluation there which included two CAT scans of chest she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung with a questionable lung abscess or cavity with hydropneumothorax.

mild infiltrates of the right lung.context: one week ago she was admitted to another hospital with hemoptysis and on her evaluation there which included two CAT scans of chest she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung with a questionable lung abscess or cavity with hydropneumothorax.

chest tube was placed.context: A chest tube was placed at the other hospital, which produced some brownish fluid that had foul odor, actually what was thought to be a fecal-like odor.

brownish fluid.context: A chest tube was placed at the other hospital, which produced some brownish fluid that had foul odor, actually what was thought to be a fecal-like odor.

foul odor.context: A chest tube was placed at the other hospital, which produced some brownish fluid that had foul odor, actually what was thought to be a fecal-like odor.

abdominal CT scan.context: An abdominal CT scan was done, which did not suggest any communication of the bowel into the pleural cavity or any other significant abnormalities in the abdomen on the abdominal CT.

bloody mucous in the left main stem bron.context: The patient had a flexible fiberoptic bronchoscopy that showed no endobronchial lesions, but there was bloody mucous in the left main stem bronchus and this was suctioned out.

erythema of the mucosa.context: Today, the double lumen tube was placed and there was some erythema of the mucosa noted in the airways in the bronchi and also remarkably bloody secretions were also noted.

bloody secretions.context: Today, the double lumen tube was placed and there was some erythema of the mucosa noted in the airways in the bronchi and also remarkably bloody secretions were also noted.

temporary obstruction of the left mainst.context: These were suctioned, but it was enough to produce a temporary obstruction of the left mainstem bronchus.

left thoracoscopy.context: Eventually, the double lumen tube was secured and an attempt at a left thoracoscopy was performed after the chest tube was removed and digital dissection was carried out through that.

digital dissection.context: Eventually, the double lumen tube was secured and an attempt at a left thoracoscopy was performed after the chest tube was removed and digital dissection was carried out through that.

chest tube tract.context: The chest tube tract, which was about in the sixth or seventh intercostal space, but it was not possible to dissect enough down to get a acceptable visualization through this tract.

second incision for thoracoscopy.context: A second incision for thoracoscopy was made about on the sixth intercostal space in the midaxillary line and again some digital dissection was carried out but it was not enough to be able to achieve an opening or space for satisfactory inspection of the pleural cavity.

pleural cavity.context: Therefore the chest was opened and remarkable findings included a very dense consolidation of the entire lung such that it was very hard and firm throughout.

dense consolidation of the entire lung.context: Therefore the chest was opened and remarkable findings included a very dense consolidation of the entire lung such that it was very hard and firm throughout.

pockets of purulent material.context: There were many pockets of purulent material, which had a gray-white appearance to it.

whitish fibrotic fibrinous deposit.context: There was quite a bit of whitish fibrotic fibrinous deposit on the parietal pleura of the lung especially the upper lobe.

adhesions.context: The apex of the lung was quite densely adhered to the parietal pleura there and the adhesions were quite thickened and firm.

abscess.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

cavity.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

grayish pus.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

caseous-like material.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

necrotic lung tissue.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

deposit related to tuberculosis.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

apex of the lung.context: The apex of the lung was quite densely adhered to the parietal pleura there and the adhesions were quite thickened and firm.

thoracoscopy.context: With the patient lying with the right side down on the operating table the left chest was prepped and draped in sterile manner.

blunt dissection.context: With the patient lying with the right side down on the operating table the left chest was prepped and draped in sterile manner.

Thoracoport.context: With the patient lying with the right side down on the operating table the left chest was prepped and draped in sterile manner.

double lumen tube.context: The patient had a flexible fiberoptic bronchoscopy that showed no endobronchial lesions, but there was bloody mucous in the left main stem bronchus and this was suctioned out.

electrocautery dissection.context: Quite a bit of blunt and sharp and electrocautery dissection was performed to take down adhesions to the set of the fibrinous deposit on the pleural cavity.

suture ligatures of Prolene.context: Specimens for culture were taken and specimens for permanent histology were taken and a frozen section of one of the most quite dense.

tissue pledget.context: When the cavity was encountered it was due to some compression and dissection of some of the fibrinous deposit in the upper lobe laterally and anterior and this became identified as a very thin layer in one area over this abscess and when it was opened it was quite large and we unroofed it completely and there was bleeding down in the depths of the cavity, which appeared to be from pulmonary veins and these were sutured with a "tissue pledget" of what was probably intercostal nozzle and endothoracic fascia with Prolene sutures.

14-French Foley catheter.context: Also as the upper lobe was retracted in caudal direction the tissue was quite dense and the superior branch of the pulmonary artery on the left side was torn and for hemostasis a 14-French Foley catheter was passed into the area of the tear and the balloon was inflated, which helped establish hemostasis and suturing was carried out again with utilizing a small pledget what was probably intercostal muscle and endothoracic fascia and this was sutured in place and the Foley catheter was removed.

Gelfoam.context: After reasonably good hemostasis was established pleural cavity was irrigated with saline.

Surgicel.context: After reasonably good hemostasis was established pleural cavity was irrigated with saline.

biopsies.context: As mentioned, biopsies were taken from multiple sites on the pleura and on the edge and on the lung.

chest tubes.context: Then two #24 Blake chest tubes were placed, one through a stab wound above the incision anteriorly and one below and one in the inferior pleural space and tubes were brought out through stab wounds necked into the skin with 0 silk.

intercostal nerve blocks.context: Intercostal nerve blocks at probably the fifth, sixth, and seventh intercostal nerves was carried out.

resection of the sixth rib.context: Then the sixth rib had been broken and with retraction the fractured ends were resected and rongeur used to smooth out the end fragments of this rib.

pericostal sutures.context: The bone was partially fractured inferiorly and it was very difficult to get the suture out through the inner cortical table, so that pericostal sutures were used with #1 Vicryl.

chest wall closure.context: The chest wall was closed with running #1 Vicryl and then 2-0 Vicryl subcutaneous and staples on the skin.
